intro: Enydra sobreyra, commonly known as the Yerba de la Luna, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are succulent and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are usually pink or red. Enydra sobreyra is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
